thread.title: Sarah Silverman calls for coup to oust Donald Trump
thread.title_full: Sarah Silverman calls for coup to oust Donald Trump

author: Helena Horton
title: Sarah Silverman calls for coup to oust Donald Trump
text:
Sarah Silverman calls for coup to oust Donald Trump She made her remarks on Twitter Credit: NBC 3 February 2017 • 10:35am 
C omedian Sarah Silverman has asked Americans to "join the resistance" to oust the "mad King" Donald Trump. 
She's joined a host of celebrities who have expressed their wish for Mr Trump to cease being president. 
Ms Silverman, who backed Bernie Sanders then Hillary Clinton in the presidential race, posted her thoughts on Twitter. 
She wrote: "WAKE UP & JOIN THE RESISTANCE. ONCE THE MILITARY IS W US FASCISTS GET OVERTHROWN. MAD KING & HIS HANDLERS GO BYE BYE". WAKE UP & JOIN THE RESISTANCE. ONCE THE MILITARY IS W US FASCISTS GET OVERTHROWN. MAD KING & HIS HANDLERS GO BYE BYE❤❤❤❤ https://t.co/Y2WZbL012A — Sarah Silverman (@SarahKSilverman) February 2, 2017 
S eemingly jokingly, she advocated the use of a military coup to oust the president. 
She sent the tweet during the protests which lead Milo Yiannopoulos' talk at UC Berkeley to be cancelled. 
Many replied to her tweet, with some calling her "delusional" and "treasonous". 
On Friday she walked back her comments, writing: ""FEAR can motivate even peacenik snowflakes 2 incite violence & last night I felt it hard. Trying 2 keep in check bc damnit I love u America". Watch | Who is in President Trump's inner circle? 02:31 
O ther celebrities have faced criticism for tweeting about their opposition to Donald Trump. 
JK Rowling has faced book-burning threats from supporters of the president for her outspoken views. 
She's accused one of these fans of "not thinking" after they said they had burned their collection of Harry Potter novels. 
The Donald Trump fan wrote: "Just burned all my Harry Potter books after being a fan for 17 years. 
"The Philosopher's Stone was one of the first books I EVER read!" 
They continued: "I'm upset it has to be that way... you embarrassed me, disgusted me and I will never read your work again". Guess it's true what they say: you can lead a girl to books about the rise and fall of an autocrat, but you still can't make her think. pic.twitter.com/oB7Aq6Xz8M — J.K. Rowling (@jk_rowling) February 1, 2017 
J K Rowling replied: "Guess it's true what they say: you can lead a girl to books about the rise and fall of an autocrat, but you still can't make her think." 
Her reply has had over 40,000 retweets. 
Another Donald Trump fan threatened to burn JK Rowling's movie's and books earlier in the week after she criticised Mike Pence. 
They said: "Glad I caught this article on Yahoo. Now I will burn your books and movies too". 
And she replied: "Well, the fumes from the DVDs might be toxic and I've still got your money, so by all means borrow my lighter".
